page.title: 05VIEWS FROM THE ESCARPMENT
page.content: We turned from the A177 onto a limestone track to reach the highest point, 193 metres above sea-level at 346393.The views are fantastic in every direction,Mr.Oliver's beef cattle scampered off frightening a curlew and sending a stoat bounding along the hawthorn hedge.To the North lay Strawberry Hill Quarry & fields of barley,beyond these the grey blocks of flats on Tyneside. In the distance the hills on the Scottish Borders.South is a steep hill with ash & whinney bushes in front of Cassop with its brownish brick houses.Beyond are fields with pylons striped straight across & white smoke from Teeside before the bulky hills of Bilsdale. Durham City is to the West and the Dales, black hills with high peaks. East is a farm,the red tops of Thornley & a factory & coke works.
